graph.original_query: You are the Orchestrator Agent.Your first action is to call SIPGoalPlannerAgent to compute goal inputs, inflation adjustment, SIP math, allocation guidance, and projections.Do not build any plans until you have read SIPGoalPlannerAgent’s outputs.Wiring RequirementPlannerAgent MUST first read the outputs from SIPGoalPlannerAgent (especially goal_input_json and computed parameters) before creating the final multi-agent plan graph for retrieval, distillation, Q&A, charts, and report.User ScenarioPlan a SIP goal with asset allocation and fund category guidance:goal_type = Retirementcurrent_age = 50retirement_age = 60override_time_horizon_years = 10currency = INRtarget_amount_min = 30000000risk_appetite = highCompute (Deterministic)time_horizon_years = max(override_time_horizon_years, retirement_age - current_age) = max(10, 60 - 50) = 10total_months = time_horizon_years * 12 = 120Risk → Return mapping (annual):very_low: 5%low: 7%low_moderate: 8%moderate: 10%high_moderate: 11%high: 12%very_high: 14%monthly_return_r = annual_return / 12For this scenario (high): annual_return = 12% → monthly_return_r = 0.12 / 12 = 0.01Inflation default: 5.5% annually unless overridden.Do (Step-by-Step)Normalize inputs → emit goal_input_json.Refer “SIP Calculation” from SIPGoalPlannerAgent.Refer “Inflation Adjustment” from SIPGoalPlannerAgent.Refer “Recommendation Engine (Fund Category Types)” from SIPGoalPlannerAgent.Output allocation_plan_json (equity %, debt %, recommended categories, notes).Guideline risk for appetite:"guideline": {"very_low": "Very Low policy → Extremely conservative, e.g., 90% debt / 10% equity","low": "Low policy → Conservative, e.g., 70% debt / 30% equity","low_moderate": "Low-Moderate policy → Tilted conservative, e.g., 60% debt / 40% equity","moderate": "Moderate policy → Balanced mix, e.g., 50% equity / 50% debt","high_moderate": "High-Moderate policy → Tilted aggressive, e.g., 60% equity / 40% debt","high": "High policy → Aggressive, e.g., 70% equity / 30% debt","very_high": "Very High policy → Extremely aggressive, e.g., 90% equity / 10% debt"}Validation Hooks: Validate schema + percentages.Visualization (ReportGeneratorAgent):Pie chart → equity vs debtBar/graph → sub-categoriesStrictness: Never recommend fund names. Only fund categories.Schemasgoal_input_json{ "goal_type": string, "target_amount": number, "currency": "INR", "time_horizon_years": number, "total_months": number, "risk_appetite": string }inflation_adjusted_json{ "inflation_pct": number, "years": number, "unadjusted_target": number, "adjusted_target": number }sip_calc_json{ "monthly_return_r": number, "months_n": number, "adjusted_target": number, "monthly_sip": number, "status": "ok" | "error", "error": string | null }allocation_plan_json{"equity_percent": number,"debt_percent": number,"recommended_fund_categories": {"equity": string[],"debt": string[],"elss_optional": boolean},"notes": {"very_low": string,"low": string,"low_moderate": string,"moderate": string,"high_moderate": string,"high": string,"very_high": string}}Outputs RequiredEmit STRICT JSON (no prose, no markdown):goal_input_jsoninflation_adjusted_jsonsip_calc_jsonallocation_plan_json====================================================================Addendum – Mandatory Report Sections for SIP Reports====================================================================All orchestrations and plan graphs must ensure downstream agents(FormatterAgent, ReportGeneratorAgent, QAAgent) enforce the followingsections in the final comprehensive_report.html:1. Executive Summary2. Goal Inputs3. Inflation Adjustment4. SIP Calculation5. Asset Allocation Plan6. Allocation Notes7. Key Recommendations8. Risk Factors and Uncertainties (≥150 words)9. SIP Charts (Projection line + Allocation doughnut)10. SIP Projection (long-horizon summary)- PlannerAgent must wire in chart_data_json (T015) and first_12_months_table_json (T016).- ReportGeneratorAgent must embed these sections in HTML.- QAAgent must validate that all sections are present and populated.====================================================================

T001.initial_thoughts: Okay, I will collect the investment goal inputs, calculate the SIP amount with inflation adjustment, map the asset allocation based on the risk profile, and prepare the JSON outputs. I'll use the provided formulas and risk appetite to annual return mappings. I'll also ensure the output is in the correct JSON format for downstream agents.

notes.very_low: Very Low policy → Extremely conservative, e.g., 90% debt / 10% equity
notes.low: Low policy → Conservative, e.g., 70% debt / 30% equity
notes.low_moderate: Low-Moderate policy → Tilted conservative, e.g., 60% debt / 40% equity
notes.moderate: Moderate policy → Balanced mix, e.g., 50% equity / 50% debt
notes.high_moderate: High-Moderate policy → Tilted aggressive, e.g., 60% equity / 40% debt
notes.high: High policy → Aggressive, e.g., 70% equity / 30% debt
notes.very_high: Very High policy → Extremely aggressive, e.g., 90% equity / 10% debt

output.final_report_html: <html>...consulting-grade formatted report to be filled by FormatterAgent/ReportGeneratorAgent...</html>

T012.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to extract fund information from the provided URLs and content, focusing on creating a fund shortlist. The input is a set of search results related to large-cap funds. I'll attempt to extract fund names, categories, and any available ratings or notes, but will not fabricate any data if it's missing. I'll create a 'fund_shortlist' JSON object as requested. A key challenge is the variable quality and completeness of the web page content, with some returning simple status messages or inaccessible content.

fund_shortlist.notes: Lists various mutual funds; requires further filtering to identify specific Large Cap funds.
Lists various mutual funds; requires further filtering to identify specific Large Cap funds. Potentially useful for performance data.

limitations: Limited direct fund data in provided content snippets.
Relies on URL patterns to infer category, needs more precise data.
Some URLs were unreachable or content was not extracted, indicated in 'notes'.
recommendations: Fetch full content from linked pages to improve data extraction.
Implement more robust fund identification logic.
Add explicit error handling for unreachable URLs.

initial_thoughts.entity_1: Let me think through this: T001 defines the investment goal (Retirement, 30000000 INR, 10 years, High risk) and provides the basis for allocation planning. It also pre-calculates the SIP amount.
initial_thoughts.entity_2: Let me think through this: T012 presents a fund shortlist, primarily consisting of 'Large Cap' funds. However, it notes that some URLs were unreachable, and content extraction was incomplete, leading to a 'medium' data reliability.
initial_thoughts.overall_observations: Let me think through this: The goal is to reconcile the funds identified in T012 with the asset allocation defined in T001, given the 'High' risk appetite. The fund shortlist is limited and mostly focuses on 'Large Cap' equity.

review_checklist.alignment_with_goal: Let me think through this: The primary goal is to align the fund shortlist with the allocation plan, considering the high-risk appetite and the need for a balanced portfolio. Have I sufficiently addressed this?
review_checklist.what_was_missed: Let me think through this: I need to consider that T012's shortlist mainly contains large-cap funds. The allocation plan needs to reflect equity and debt components as per the 'High' risk profile. I should address the missing debt component in the fund recommendations.
review_checklist.risk_of_misleading: Let me think through this: If I only focus on the provided 'Large Cap' funds, the recommendation could be misconstrued as a complete investment portfolio, ignoring the necessary debt component. This needs to be clearly addressed in the final report.
review_checklist.improvement_opportunities: Let me think through this: I can improve the allocation plan by explicitly recommending debt fund categories to complement the equity component. I also need to justify the allocation percentages based on the 'High' risk appetite and the provided guidelines.

final_report.summary: Reconciled fund shortlist from T012 with allocation plan from T001. Recommended debt fund categories to balance the 'High' risk profile allocation.
final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: This report aligns the fund shortlist provided in T012 with the asset allocation plan defined in T001, considering a 'High' risk appetite. T001 established a retirement goal of 30,000,000 INR over 10 years, resulting in a SIP amount of 252,371.76 INR per month after inflation adjustment. The 'High' risk appetite maps to an annual return of 12%, and an initial allocation plan of 70% equity and 30% debt. However, the fund shortlist in T012 is primarily focused on 'Large Cap' equity funds, with indications that content extraction from source URLs was incomplete.

To address the imbalance, this report recommends complementing the existing 'Large Cap' fund focus with debt fund categories. Given the 30% debt allocation requirement, the following debt fund categories are recommended: 'Corporate Bond Funds' and 'Short Duration Funds', as outlined in T001's allocation plan. These categories provide a mix of stability and returns suitable for balancing the portfolio's overall risk profile. The 'Large Cap' funds can fulfill the equity portion of the allocation. Due to incomplete content extraction of T012 fund shortlist, further research is recommended on individual fund selection and performance data for the 'Large Cap' and debt fund categories. 

The revised allocation plan, based on the inputs from T001 and addressing the limitations of T012, is as follows:

*   **Equity (70%):** Large Cap Funds (as identified in T012 and subject to further review)
*   **Debt (30%):** Corporate Bond Funds, Short Duration Funds

The rationale for this allocation is rooted in the 'High' risk appetite specified in T001. According to the provided guidelines, a 'High' risk profile corresponds to an aggressive investment strategy, suitable for investors with a longer time horizon and a higher tolerance for market fluctuations. By allocating 70% to equity and 30% to debt, the portfolio aims to achieve the desired growth while mitigating potential downside risks. It's imperative to note that the fund selection within each category should be based on rigorous due diligence, considering factors such as fund performance, expense ratios, and fund manager expertise. The incomplete extraction of fund information in T012 highlights the necessity of conducting additional research to ensure the selection of appropriate funds within each category. Specifically, the unreachability of URLs and the partial content extraction necessitate a more thorough investigation before making any investment decisions. Furthermore, the reliance on URL patterns to infer the category, as noted in T012, introduces a potential source of error, underscoring the need for more precise data verification. Finally, the allocation percentages are based on the guidelines from T001; individual circumstances and preferences may require adjustment. It is recommended that investors consult with a financial advisor to customize the allocation plan to their specific needs and circumstances.
recommendations: Conduct thorough due diligence on fund selection within recommended categories (Large Cap, Corporate Bond Funds, Short Duration Funds).
Fetch full content from linked pages in T012 to improve data extraction and fund identification.
Implement more robust fund identification logic to avoid relying solely on URL patterns.
Consult with a financial advisor to customize the allocation plan to individual needs and circumstances.
risks_or_warnings: The fund shortlist in T012 is incomplete and requires further verification.
The recommended allocation plan is based on a 'High' risk appetite and may not be suitable for all investors.
Market fluctuations can impact investment returns, and there is no guarantee of achieving the target amount.
Inflation rates can vary and may impact the real value of investment returns.

notes.very_low: Very Low policy → Extremely conservative, e.g., 90% debt / 10% equity
notes.low: Low policy → Conservative, e.g., 70% debt / 30% equity
notes.low_moderate: Low-Moderate policy → Tilted conservative, e.g., 60% debt / 40% equity
notes.moderate: Moderate policy → Balanced mix, e.g., 50% equity / 50% debt
notes.high_moderate: High-Moderate policy → Tilted aggressive, e.g., 60% equity / 40% debt
notes.high: High policy → Aggressive, e.g., 70% equity / 30% debt
notes.very_high: Very High policy → Extremely aggressive, e.g., 90% equity / 10% debt

output.validation_summary: All checks passed. The calculations are mathematically sound, asset allocation percentages sum up to 100%, the fund shortlist is not empty, and the currency is present. The goal input JSON is also properly typed and bounded.

I'll handle potential errors by providing default values and displaying a message if necessary.

nodes.description: Reconcile fund shortlist with allocation categories and percentages from T001.
nodes.agent_prompt: Reconcile the fund shortlist from T012 with the allocation categories and percentages defined in T001, ensuring alignment with the overall investment plan.

initial_thoughts.entity_1: Let me think through this: T001 defines the investment goal (Retirement, 30000000 INR, 10 years, High risk) and provides the basis for allocation planning. It also pre-calculates the SIP amount.
initial_thoughts.entity_2: Let me think through this: T012 presents a fund shortlist, primarily consisting of 'Large Cap' funds. However, it notes that some URLs were unreachable, and content extraction was incomplete, leading to a 'medium' data reliability.
initial_thoughts.overall_observations: Let me think through this: The goal is to reconcile the funds identified in T012 with the asset allocation defined in T001, given the 'High' risk appetite. The fund shortlist is limited and mostly focuses on 'Large Cap' equity.

review_checklist.alignment_with_goal: Let me think through this: The primary goal is to align the fund shortlist with the allocation plan, considering the high-risk appetite and the need for a balanced portfolio. Have I sufficiently addressed this?
review_checklist.what_was_missed: Let me think through this: I need to consider that T012's shortlist mainly contains large-cap funds. The allocation plan needs to reflect equity and debt components as per the 'High' risk profile. I should address the missing debt component in the fund recommendations.
review_checklist.risk_of_misleading: Let me think through this: If I only focus on the provided 'Large Cap' funds, the recommendation could be misconstrued as a complete investment portfolio, ignoring the necessary debt component. This needs to be clearly addressed in the final report.
review_checklist.improvement_opportunities: Let me think through this: I can improve the allocation plan by explicitly recommending debt fund categories to complement the equity component. I also need to justify the allocation percentages based on the 'High' risk appetite and the provided guidelines.

final_report.summary: Reconciled fund shortlist from T012 with allocation plan from T001. Recommended debt fund categories to balance the 'High' risk profile allocation.
final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: This report aligns the fund shortlist provided in T012 with the asset allocation plan defined in T001, considering a 'High' risk appetite. T001 established a retirement goal of 30,000,000 INR over 10 years, resulting in a SIP amount of 252,371.76 INR per month after inflation adjustment. The 'High' risk appetite maps to an annual return of 12%, and an initial allocation plan of 70% equity and 30% debt. However, the fund shortlist in T012 is primarily focused on 'Large Cap' equity funds, with indications that content extraction from source URLs was incomplete.

To address the imbalance, this report recommends complementing the existing 'Large Cap' fund focus with debt fund categories. Given the 30% debt allocation requirement, the following debt fund categories are recommended: 'Corporate Bond Funds' and 'Short Duration Funds', as outlined in T001's allocation plan. These categories provide a mix of stability and returns suitable for balancing the portfolio's overall risk profile. The 'Large Cap' funds can fulfill the equity portion of the allocation. Due to incomplete content extraction of T012 fund shortlist, further research is recommended on individual fund selection and performance data for the 'Large Cap' and debt fund categories. 

The revised allocation plan, based on the inputs from T001 and addressing the limitations of T012, is as follows:

*   **Equity (70%):** Large Cap Funds (as identified in T012 and subject to further review)
*   **Debt (30%):** Corporate Bond Funds, Short Duration Funds

The rationale for this allocation is rooted in the 'High' risk appetite specified in T001. According to the provided guidelines, a 'High' risk profile corresponds to an aggressive investment strategy, suitable for investors with a longer time horizon and a higher tolerance for market fluctuations. By allocating 70% to equity and 30% to debt, the portfolio aims to achieve the desired growth while mitigating potential downside risks. It's imperative to note that the fund selection within each category should be based on rigorous due diligence, considering factors such as fund performance, expense ratios, and fund manager expertise. The incomplete extraction of fund information in T012 highlights the necessity of conducting additional research to ensure the selection of appropriate funds within each category. Specifically, the unreachability of URLs and the partial content extraction necessitate a more thorough investigation before making any investment decisions. Furthermore, the reliance on URL patterns to infer the category, as noted in T012, introduces a potential source of error, underscoring the need for more precise data verification. Finally, the allocation percentages are based on the guidelines from T001; individual circumstances and preferences may require adjustment. It is recommended that investors consult with a financial advisor to customize the allocation plan to their specific needs and circumstances.
recommendations: Conduct thorough due diligence on fund selection within recommended categories (Large Cap, Corporate Bond Funds, Short Duration Funds).
Fetch full content from linked pages in T012 to improve data extraction and fund identification.
Implement more robust fund identification logic to avoid relying solely on URL patterns.
Consult with a financial advisor to customize the allocation plan to individual needs and circumstances.
risks_or_warnings: The fund shortlist in T012 is incomplete and requires further verification.
The recommended allocation plan is based on a 'High' risk appetite and may not be suitable for all investors.
Market fluctuations can impact investment returns, and there is no guarantee of achieving the target amount.
Inflation rates can vary and may impact the real value of investment returns.

notes.very_low: Very Low policy → Extremely conservative, e.g., 90% debt / 10% equity
notes.low: Low policy → Conservative, e.g., 70% debt / 30% equity
notes.low_moderate: Low-Moderate policy → Tilted conservative, e.g., 60% debt / 40% equity
notes.moderate: Moderate policy → Balanced mix, e.g., 50% equity / 50% debt
notes.high_moderate: High-Moderate policy → Tilted aggressive, e.g., 60% equity / 40% debt
notes.high: High policy → Aggressive, e.g., 70% equity / 30% debt
notes.very_high: Very High policy → Extremely aggressive, e.g., 90% equity / 10% debt

nodes.agent_prompt: Create a consulting-grade HTML report structure, incorporating the outputs of the previous tasks. Ensure that the report is well-organized, visually appealing, and easy to understand.

Package the final comprehensive report in HTML format, incorporating all the required sections and elements as outlined in the guidelines. The report must include: 1. Executive Summary, 2. Goal Inputs, 3. Inflation Adjustment, 4. SIP Calculation, 5. Asset Allocation Plan, 6. Allocation Notes, 7. Key Recommendations, 8. Risk Factors and Uncertainties (≥150 words), 9. SIP Charts (Projection line + Allocation doughnut), 10. SIP Projection (long-horizon summary).
Schedule an optional cron/daily refresh to update the report with the latest data and market conditions.
